meanings.definition: Ready, eager, or prepared to do something
meanings.sent1: She is the willingest student in the class, always eager to help others.
meanings.sent2: The team chose the willingest member to lead the project due to her readiness.
meanings.sent3: The willingest squirrel in the park happily collected acorns for the winter.
meanings.sent4: His willingest smile brightened up the room, showing his eagerness to participate.
meanings.sent5: The willingest puppy wagged its tail excitedly, ready for a walk.

meanings.definition: Most ready, eager, or prepared to do something
meanings.sent1: Among all the candidates, she was the willingest to take on new challenges.
meanings.sent2: The willingest worker in the office always finishes tasks ahead of time.
meanings.sent3: The willingest baker in town created a cake that was too eager to be eaten.
meanings.sent4: His willingest effort in the game led the team to victory.
meanings.sent5: The willingest volunteer happily served meals at the shelter, showing her eagerness to help.
